intro: Gymnogyne cotuloides, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow-orange ray flowers surrounded by a dense cluster of small, tubular disk flowers. Gymnogyne cotuloides typically grows in grasslands and open areas, often forming dense mats. It is noted for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
